intro: Aceras hircinum var. calamistratum, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
